description: According to the AP, as early as this date, Paul Manafort pitched a plan to Russian oligarch Oleg Deripaska to consult for the Putin government. Manafort denies his work was pro-Russian. Deripaska sued for libel.
headline: AP Exclusive: Before Trump job, Manafort worked to aid Putin

description: Trump sells Florida mansion to Russian billionaire for $95 million.
headline: That time a Russian billionaire paid Trump $95 million for a mansion

description: Cohen tells Page Six that Trump is considering presidential run, spent $1 million on research.
headline: Trump researching 2016 run

description: Trump sends letter to Putin inviting him to the Miss Universe pageant, according to the Washington Post.
headline: In a personal letter, Trump invited Putin to the 2013 Miss Universe pageant

description: Trump tells David Letterman: "I've done a lot of business with the Russians."
headline: Donald Trump on David Letterman 17 October, 2013 Full Interview

description: Trump holds Miss Universe (which he owns) in Moscow, meets Russian entrepreneurs.
headline: Are you a robot?

description: Trump tweets that U.S. must be strategic with Russia.
headline: Donald J. Trump on Twitter

description: In Ukraine, Yanukovych abruptly breaks with EU and embraces billions in aid from Moscow, contrary to Manafort's advice.
headline: Timeline: Political crisis in Ukraine and Russia's occupation of Crimea

description: U.S. authorizes sanctions on Russia.
headline: Ukraine and Russia Sanctions

description: Russia is ousted from the G8 group of industrial nations, because of its move to annex Crimea.
headline: Russia Is Ousted From Group of 8 by U.S. and Allies

description: CNN reports the State Deptartment suspects Russians are behind a continuing, nearly yearlong and "worst ever" hack.
headline: Sources: State Dept. hack the 'worst ever'

description: Rise in Russian cyberattacks.
headline: Obama to Putin: Stop Hacking Me

description: U.S. cybersecurity expert says he is seeing dramatic rise in cyber aggression from Russia.
headline: Obama to Putin: Stop Hacking Me

description: DOD secretary Ashton Carter reveals suspected Russian hack of Pentagon.
Trump announces candidacy for president.
headline: Donald Trump Presidential Campaign Announcement Full Speech (C-SPAN)

description: Trump announces candidacy for president.
headline: Donald Trump Presidential Campaign Announcement Full Speech (C-SPAN)

description: Russians launch cyberattack against the Pentagon's Joint Staff email system. Officials shut it down temporarily.
headline: Russia hacks Pentagon computers: NBC, citing sources

description: Trump and Flynn first meet, speak for 90 minutes.
headline: Trump adviser Michael T. Flynn on his dinner with Putin and why Russia Today is just like CNN

description: Trump and Flynn first meet, speak for 90 minutes.
headline: Trump adviser Michael T. Flynn on his dinner with Putin and why Russia Today is just like CNN

description: Flynn receives a $11,250 payment from a Russian freight company. Reason for the pay is unknown.
headline: Flynn took money from multiple Russian firms

description: FBI begins Clinton email investigation.
headline: FBI looking into the security of Hillary Clinton’s private e-mail setup

description: FBI begins investigating Hillary Clinton's use of a private email server while Secretary of State.
headline: FBI looking into the security of Hillary Clinton’s private e-mail setup

description: Stone leaves Trump campaign.
headline: Roger Stone says he quit, Trump camp says it fired him

description: Jeff Sessions, then a senator, appears at Trump rally wearing a 'Make America Great Again' hat.
headline: What Jeff Sessions said about Russia, and when

description: Trump said he got to know Putin "very well" because they were both on the same episode of 60 Minutes. Several media outlets reported that the leaders were not at the same location.
headline: Here's the Deal With That Putin 60 Minutes Episode Trump Mentioned

description: The @Ten_GOP twitter account is created. It's purported to be the Tennessee Republicans but is later reported to be Russian trolls. It pushes support of Michael Flynn, allegations of vote fraud and gets dozens of RT's from Trump campaign staffers.
headline: Trump Campaign Staffers Pushed Russian Propaganda Days Before the Election

description: Flynn and his son meet with Russian ambassador Kislyak, seemingly at Flynn's request.
Flynn is paid $45,000 to appear at Russian TV (RT) gala in Moscow.
headline: Trump adviser Flynn paid by multiple Russia-related entities, new records show

description: Trump and Putin praise each other, saying in separate statements they want better relations.
headline: From Russia with love: Putin, Trump sing each other's praises

description: Flynn is a Trump adviser.
headline: Trump being advised by ex-U.S. Lieutenant General who favors closer Russia ties

description: Sessions formally endorses Trump.
headline: Sen. Jeff Sessions endorses Trump

description: Manafort sends written pitch to Trump to work on the campaign.
headline: To Charm Trump, Paul Manafort Sold Himself as an Affordable Outsider

description: Sessions becomes chairman of the Trump campaign's national security advisory team.
headline: Trump appoints Sessions National Security chairman

description: According to Papadopolous, a Trump "campaign supervisor," later identified as Sam Clovis, told him the campaign had a foreign policy goal of U.S.-Russia relations. Clovis' lawyer disputed that.
In Italy, Papadopoulos meets "the professor," who claims to be close with Russian officials.
The Trump campaign says Sessions will also lead Trump's foreign policy advisory team.
headline: Trump Campaign Releases New Details About Sessions’ Role As Foreign Policy Adviser

description: Clinton campaign chair John Podesta opens a phishing email sent by Russian hackers.
headline: The Perfect Weapon: How Russian Cyberpower Invaded the U.S.

description: Russian hackers steal 50,000 of Podesta's emails, according to indictment.
Trump says Papadopoulos is on his campaign team.
headline: Trump names foreign policy team members

description: Trump says Carter Page is on his campaign team.
headline: Trump names foreign policy team members

description: Another Clinton staffer falls for phishing scam.
headline: The Perfect Weapon: How Russian Cyberpower Invaded the U.S.

description: In London, the "professor" introduces Papadopoulos to a "native Russian female" contact, supposedly a Putin relative. Papadopolous emails his campaign supervisor, who responds "great work."
Manafort hired by Trump campaign.
headline: Donald Trump Hires Paul Manafort to Lead Delegate Effort

description: Trump meets with his national security team, including Sessions and Papadopoulos. The latter says he could arrange a meeting with Putin.
Trump meets with his natl security team, including Sessions and Papadopolous. The latter says he could arrange a meeting w/ Putin.
Russians create fake email account and use it to target more than 30 Clinton campaign staffers, according to indictment.
Papadopoulos and his female Russian contact exchange emails about setting up a potential Russia trip.
Russians hack into the DNC computer network via the DCCC network, according to indictment.
The "professor" introduces Papadopoulos to a person said to be connected to the Russian foreign ministry.
Russian goverment hackers register the website domain "DCLeaks," according to indictment.
Russian hackers prompt malware placed on DCCC computers to start taking directions from the hackers, according to indictment.
Russian hackers steal gigabytes of DNC data, moving it to a computer they leased in Illinois, according to indictment.
Papadopoulos and his foreign ministry contact exchange more emails.
Papadopoulos emails a senior campaign advisor indicating the Russians are ready to meet with Trump.
The "professor" tells Trump advisor Papadopoulos that Russians have "thousands" of Hillary Clinton emails.
The "professor" tells Papadopoulos that Russians have "thousands" of Hillary Clinton emails.
Trump meets Russian ambassador Sergey Kislyak.
headline: Donald Trump met Russian ambassador Sergey Kislyak during election campaign

description: Papadopoulos emails a senior campaign advisor that he has some interesting messages from Moscow.
Sessions may have met with Kislyak.
headline: First on CNN: Sources: Congress investigating another possible Sessions-Kislyak meeting

description: Russian foreign ministry contact emails Papadopoulos about a possible meeting in Moscow.
Near this date, Manafort meets with former Ukraine associate and Russian Army veteran Konstantin Kilimnik.
headline: At height of Russia tensions, Trump campaign chairman Manafort met with business associate from Ukraine

description: Russian hackers clear DNC computer logs that documented their presence, according to indictment.
headline: Russian government hackers penetrated DNC, stole opposition research on Trump

description: The "professor" emails Papadopoulos, who then emails a high-ranking campaign official that Russia would like to host Trump.
Intel director tells of attempted cyberattacks on presidential campaigns.
headline: Clapper: Cyber threats against presidential campaigns are growing

description: Manafort becomes campaign chairman.
headline: Veteran strategist Paul Manafort becomes Trump’s campaign chairman

description: Papadopoulos emails another high-ranking campaign official about the idea of a Trump meeting with Russia.
Trump clinches the GOP nomination for president.
headline: Donald Trump Clinches GOP Nomination

description: Papadopoulos emails a high-ranking campaign official and then his campaign supervisor about a Trump meeting with Russian officials.
In email chain, Donald Trump Jr. agrees to meet with Russian officials, says "I love it" to their offer to damage Hillary Clinton.
headline: Read the Emails on Donald Trump Jr.’s Russia Meeting

description: Trump announces he will give a "major speech" within days to discuss things that have happened with the Clintons.
headline: Trump to Give Major Hillary Speech Monday

description: Russian hackers launch the website "DCLeaks" where they release stolen emails, according to indictment.
headline: Russian government hackers penetrated DNC, stole opposition research on Trump

description: As result of June 3 email, Russian lawyer meets at Trump Tower with Donald Trump. Jr, Kushner, Manafort and other Russians. Trump Jr. says the lawyer gave no information on Clinton or anything campaign-related
headline: What We Know About Donald Trump Jr.’s Russia Meeting

description: As result of June 3 email, Russian lawyer meets at Trump Tower with Donald Trump. Jr, Kushner, Manafort and other Russians. Trump Jr. says the lawyer gave no information on Clinton or anything campaign-related
headline: What We Know About Donald Trump Jr.’s Russia Meeting

description: As result of June 3 email, Russian lawyer meets at Trump Tower with Donald Trump. Jr, Kushner, Manafort and other Russians. Trump Jr. says the lawyer gave no information on Clinton or anything campaign-related
headline: What We Know About Donald Trump Jr.’s Russia Meeting

description: Russian magnate Aras Agalarov delivers an "expensive painting" to Trump for his birthday.
DNC announces it was hacked.
headline: Russian government hackers penetrated DNC, stole opposition research on Trump

description: DNC announces it was hacked.
headline: Russian government hackers penetrated DNC, stole opposition research on Trump

description: DNC's cybersecurity firm reports that Russians hacked the party's system.
headline: Bears in the Midst: Intrusion into the Democratic National Committee »

description: In response to DNC announcment, Russian hackers create and launch "Guccifer 2.0," according to indictment.
Trump accuses DNC of being behind the hack of their system.
headline: Trump accuses DNC of 'hacking' its own oppo research on him

description: Putin says he does not have a preference for who wins U.S. election, though he welcomes Trump's pledge to restore U.S.-Russia ties. "We never interfere in other countries’ internal politics, especially the U.S."
headline: Are you a robot?

description: Trump writes effusive thank you note to Agalarov for the painting.
Papadopoulos writes the high-ranking campaign official that Russians would meet with him, off record, instead of Trump, if Trump is not an option.
Russian government hackers are blocked by a U.S. security company from further DNC hacks. The hackers delete more computer logs, according to indictment.
This date is given for the first entry in the publicly-released "Trump dossier" alleging Russian attempts to influence him.
headline: How a Sensational, Unverified Dossier Became a Crisis for Donald Trump

description: Guccifer 2.0 leaks DNC hack documents about Clinton.
headline: Dossier on Hillary Clinton from DNC

description: Trump fires campaign manager Corey Lewandowski, Manafort takes over.
headline: Canning Corey: Why Trump firing Lewandowski could shift his campaign

description: Manafort takes over running Trump's campaign.
headline: Donald Trump tries to hit reset by firing campaign manager Corey Lewandowski

description: "Organization 1" reaches out to Guccifer 2.0 asking for any new Clinton docs, according to indictment. "Organization 1" is now believed to be Wikileaks.
Trump campaign signs contract with Cambridge Analytica, according to the Wall Street Journal.
headline: Data Firm’s WikiLeaks Outreach Came as It Joined Trump Campaign

description: Trump gives NYC speech focused on his criticism of Hillary Clinton. It's unclear if this is what he was signaling June 7.
headline: Full transcript: Donald Trump NYC speech on stakes of the election

description: Arizona freezes voter registration site for a week after FBI hacking warning.
headline: Harry Reid Cites Evidence of Russian Tampering in U.S. Vote, and Seeks F.B.I. Inquiry

description: Comey closes Clinton email investigation.

description: Comey closes Clinton email investigation.

description: Manafort writes in an email that he is willing to brief a VIP believed to be Russian oligarch Oleg Deripaska, according to WaPo. It's unclear if the briefings happened.

description: Page gives a lecture in Moscow.
headline: THE LECTURE OF TRUMP’S ADVISOR CARTER PAGE IN MOSCOW

description: Trump campaign helps change GOP platform on Ukraine/Russia.
headline: Trump campaign guts GOP’s anti-Russia stance on Ukraine

description: Hackers, posing as Guccifer 2.0, send "Organization 1" - suspected to be Wikileaks - an archive of stolen DNC documents, according to indictment.
Trump chooses Pence as VP.
headline: It's Official: Trump Announces Mike Pence as VP Pick

description: Around this time, an FBI informant meets Page at a conference.
headline: F.B.I. Used Informant to Investigate Russia Ties to Campaign, Not to Spy, as Trump Claims

description: Donald Trump Jr. disputes Democratic claims about Russian hacking.

description: FBI begins investigation of DNC hack.

description: FBI begins investigation of DNC hack.

description: On or around this date, Russian military intelligence officers begin to target email addresses associated with Hillary Clinton’s personal and campaign offices.

description: Trump says he hopes Russia finds missing Clinton emails.
headline: Trump: I hope Russia finds 'the 30,000 emails that are missing'

description: Trump: Crimea prefers Russia.

description: Trump campaign: Page is informal adviser.

description: Roger Stone writes that Guccifer 2.0, not Russia, is responsible for hack.
headline: Dear Hillary: DNC Hack Solved, So Now Stop Blaming Russia

description: Flynn signs $600,000 contract to lobby for firm tied to Turkish government.

description: Hackers release cell phone numbers, personal information and other documents about Democratic members of Congress.

description: An unnamed candidate for U.S. Congress reaches out to Russian hackers posing as  "Guccifer 2.0" to request stolen documents on their opponent, according to indictment. The hackers provide those documents.
Manafort strongly denies taking any "off-books" cash for work in Ukraine.
headline: Trump campaign chair denies he accepted Ukraine cash payments

description: Papadopoulos' campaign supervisor writes to encourage him to attend an off-record trip to Russia, "if feasible."
Manafort leaves Trump's campaign.

description: Manafort resigns as Trump's campaign chair.

description: Stone tweets Podesta's "time" is coming.
headline: Account Suspended

description: Russian hackers send stolen DCCC data to a lobbyist and unnamed online news source. Same day, the hackers send stolen documents about the Black Lives Matter movement to an unnamed reporter, according to indictment.

description: President Obama tells Putin to stop hacking.
headline: Obama says he told Putin to ‘cut it out’ on Russia hacking

description: Trump to Russian TV: Russia interference "pretty unlikely."

description: Christopher Steele writes in his dossier that a Kremlin insider told him Manafort had led efforts for a secret Trump-campaign relationship with Russians, until his ouster.

description: Trump wins the presidency.

description: Donald Trump Jr. again retweets @Ten_GOP account later blocked by Twitter and reportedly run by Russian trolls.

description: Manafort's son-in-law's real estate company declares bankruptcy, documents millions owed to Manafort.

description: DHS and FBI publish report about "Grizzly Steppe" or Russian hacking operation.
Flynn held five phone calls with Kislyak, discussing new sanctions.

description: Russia says it will not retaliate for sanctions.
Trump quotes Assange, who said a 14-year-old could have hacked the DNC. 'Why was the DNC so careless?' Trump asks.

description: Flynn tells transition team lawyer his work as a secret paid lobbyist for Turkey is under investigation.

description: Intel chiefs say Russia ordered campaign to influence U.S. elections and help Trump.
Comey meets Trump in New York at a briefing on Russia and tells him he is not under investigation.
Kushner joins White House as special adviser.

description: Sen. Intell. Committee launches its Russia investigation.

description: In Senate intelligence hearing, Comey won't say if FBI is investigating Trump.

description: Cohen tweets "I have never been to Prague in my life," refuting a charge from the Steele dossier that he met Russians there in 2016.

description: Buzzfeed publishes dossier from former British intelligence officer, with lengthy and some salacious allegations of how Russians tried to compromise Trump and his campaign. Trump tweets it is "fake news."

description: In a news conference, Trump says for the first time he believes Russia was behind the DNC hack.
headline: Trump Says ‘I Think It Was Russia’ That Hacked the Democrats

description: Blackwater founder Erik Prince meets with Kirill Dmitriev, head of a Russian-government backed fund who has ties to Putin, in Seychelles.This was reportedly to open a back channel between Moscow and the Trump campaign. Lebanese-American businessman George Nader reportedly helped arrange it. (NYT, WaPo)
headline: Mueller gathers evidence that 2017 Seychelles meeting was effort to establish back channel to Kremlin

description: Pence tells 'Face the Nation' that Flynn did not talk sanctions with the Russians. (Pence later learns this isn't true.)

description: Sens. Warren, Cardin ask Treasury to investigate Scaramucci-Russia Fund interaction.

description: Russian tycoon and Putin ally Viktor Vekselberg attends Trump's inauguration, according to WaPo. The NYT reported he was the guest of his cousin and RNC donor Andrew Intrater and met with Michael Cohen.
headline: In the crowd at Trump’s inauguration, members of Russia’s elite anticipated a thaw between Moscow and Washington

description: The FBI interviews Papadopoulos a second time.
The FBI interviews Papadopoulos a second time.

description: Judge orders Manafort to jail to await trial, ending house arrest. This is due to charges of witness tampering.
headline: Paul Manafort ordered to jail after witness-tampering charges

description: Trump says he feels badly for Flynn and that "it turns out maybe he didn't lie."
headline: CSPAN on Twitter

description: A new Mueller indictment accuses 12 Russians of hacking into computers used by Clinton's campaign, Democratic organizations and state elections officials, among others.
headline: Read Mueller’s full indictment against 12 Russian officers for election interference

description: At summit, Putin denies Russian election meddling. Trump says "I don't see any reason why" Russia would interfere.
headline: WATCH: Trump refuses to acknowledge that Russia meddled in U.S. elections

description: Putin says Russia "has never interfered and will never interfere" in U.S elections. He adds that he had hoped Trump would win "because he talked about bringing the U.S.-Russia relationship back to normal."
headline: WATCH: Trump refuses to acknowledge that Russia meddled in U.S. elections

description: Before meeting with Putin, Trump blames past administrations and the "rigged witch hunt" for what he says are poor relations with Russia.
headline: Donald J. Trump on Twitter

description: Trump says he misspoke, meant to say he didn't see why Russia "wouldn't" have meddled in the election.
headline: Trump now says he misspoke on Russian meddling, believes election interference took place

description: Trump says "no" when asked whether Russia was still targeting the U.S. Hours later, his press secretary says Trump said "no" to more questions.
headline: Trump says 'no,' Russia not still targeting U.S.

description: Trump asks National Security Advisor John Bolton to invite Putin to the U.S. this fall.
headline: Sarah Sanders on Twitter

description: Microsoft's security chief says "earlier this year" they saw attempted phishing attacks against three congressional candidates. (One is later identified as Sen. Claire McCaskill.)
Trump asks National Security Advisor John Bolton to invite Putin to the U.S. this fall.
headline: Sarah Sanders on Twitter

description: The FBI releases more than 400 pages of documents related to Carter Page wiretaps, showing agents believed Page was recruited by Russia.
The FBI releases more than 400 pages of documents related to Carter Page wiretaps, showing agents believed Page was recruited by Russia.
Trump tweets that the Mueller investigation is a hoax and incorrectly claims it was sparked by the "whole FISA scam."
headline: Donald J. Trump on Twitter

description: Page tells CNN that the idea of Russians trying to recruit him is "totally unreasonable."
headline: CNN on Twitter

description: Trump claims without evidence that Russia will be "pushing very hard" to help Democrats in the midterms.
headline: Trump says without evidence that Russia will be ‘pushing very hard’ to help Democrats win in 2018

description: Bolton says Putin's U.S. trip is postponed to 2019 because president believes it "should take place after the Russia witch hunt is over."
headline: Trump delays proposed Putin meeting until 2019

description: Sen. Claire McCaskill, D-Mo., says Russian hackers unsuccessfully tried to infiltrate her Senate computer network."
headline: U.S. Senator Claire McCaskill of Missouri

description: Mueller's team asks judge to sentence Papadopolous to up to six months for lying to them.
headline: Mueller team wants George Papadopoulos jailed 6 months

description: Mueller's team asks judge to sentence Papadopolous to up to six months for lying to them.
headline: Mueller team wants George Papadopoulos jailed 6 months

description: WH counsel McGahn's attorney confirms NYT report that he spoke with Mueller's investigators.
headline: President Trump Attacks Report On White House Counsel's Cooperation With Mueller

description: As NYT reports that WH Counsel McGahn spoke with Mueller's team, Trump tweets that he allowed those interviews.
headline: Donald J. Trump on Twitter

description: The president writes that the Mueller investigation makes Joseph McCarthy look like a baby.
headline: Donald J. Trump on Twitter

description: Microsoft announces Russian hackers attempted to target conservative think tanks that advocated tougher action against Russia.
headline: New Russian Hacking Targeted Republican Groups, Microsoft Says
